trans-unit.source: Represents a combination of a standard button on the left and a drop-down button on the right, or the other way around if the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft"></xref> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Yes" name="Yes" href=""></xref>.
ToolStripSplitButton combines button and drop-down button functionality.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DefaultItem%2A> property to synchronize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event of the chosen drop-down item with the item shown on the button.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class with the specified image.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class with the specified text.
The text to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class with the specified text and image.
The text to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class with the specified display text, image, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event handler.
The text to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class with the specified text, image, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> array.
The text to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> array of controls.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> class with the specified display text, image, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event handler, and name.
The text to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether default or custom <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> text is displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Set the AutoToolTip property to `false` to display custom text on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if default <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> text is displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets the size and location of the standard button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the size and location of the standard button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Occurs when the standard button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Occurs when the standard button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is double-clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets a value indicating whether the button portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is in the pressed state.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the button portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is in the pressed state; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets a value indicating whether the standard button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is selected or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DropDownButtonPressed*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is selected or whether <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DropDownButtonPressed*> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
A new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Creates a generic <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> for which events can be defined.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether to display the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> that is defined as the default.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Gets or sets the portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> that is activated when the control is first selected.
If a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> has a DefaultItem, the ENTER key activates the button.
Otherwise, the ENTER key activates the drop-down.
Use the DefaultItem property to synchronize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event of the chosen drop-down item with the item shown on the button.

A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Forms.ToolStripItem" name="Forms.ToolStripItem" href=""></xref> representing the portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> that is activated when first selected.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DefaultItem*> has changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets a value indicating whether items on a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> are hidden after they are clicked.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the items are hidden after they are clicked; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the size and location, in screen coordinates, of the drop-down button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the size and location of the drop-down button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>, in screen coordinates.
Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is in the pressed state.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the drop-down portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is in the pressed state; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is selected.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the drop-down button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> is selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The width, in pixels, of the drop-down button portion of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
An <xref:System.Int32> representing the width in pixels.
The default is 11.
Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_2015](~/add/includes/net-2015-md.md)], the default value is based on the DPI setting of the device running the app.
The specified value is less than zero (0).
Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> can be fitted.
The custom-sized area for a control.
An ordered pair of type <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref>, representing the width and height of a rectangle.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.ButtonClick"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnButtonClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.ButtonDoubleClick"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnButtonDoubleClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DefaultItemChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnDefaultItemChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMouseDown method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseLeave"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMouseLeave method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseUp"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMouseUp method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Paint"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeftChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnRightToLeftChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Enabled*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.OnButtonClick*> method.
Processes a dialog key.
This method is called during message preprocessing to handle the ENTER and SPACEBAR keys in order to raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click> event.
However, if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> is not enabled, this method calls the base class implementation instead.
This method is called only if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsInputKey%2A> method indicates that the item is not processing the key.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the key was processed by the item; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Processes a mnemonic character.
The character to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
This method is not relevant to this class.
This method is not relevant to this class.
Gets the boundaries of the separator between the standard and drop-down button portions of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref>.
Use the SplitterBounds property to do custom painting.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the size and location of the separator.
